Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown; possible traces of faded added white bands; exterior: at top of sherd, faint traces of two brown bands; below, part of possible ray; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Rising rays are usually found on the cul of Wild Goat Style chalices; they disappear from the repertoire in circa 600BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0088) (phase 2)
